election_record.label: Virginia 1803 House of Delegates, Norfolk County

overview.note: "Yesterday came on the election for member of Congress, and members for the State Legislature, for the county of Norfolk, when Thomas Newton, jun. Esq. was returned for Congress, there being no opposition. For delegates, the poll stood thus: William C. Holt 277, Arthur Lee 200, William King 164, James Callis 149, Nehemiah Forman 77." Norfolk Herald (Norfolk, VA), April 19, 1803; Republican Star or Eastern Shore General Advertiser (Easton, MD), April 26, 1803; and, Alexandria Advertiser and Commercial Intelligencer (Alexandria, VA), April 26, 1803.

According to the Original Election Returns, the Register of the General Assembly of Virginia (1918) and the Bicentennial Register of Members (1978), the person chosen from Norfolk County in 1803 was James Holt. The name "William C. Holt" appeared in the Norfolk Herald (Norfolk, VA) and the error was reprinted in other newspapers. William C. Holt was a very prominent Norfolk County politican and would also be elected to the House of Delegates within a few years.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Library of Virginia, Richmond.
Alexandria Advertiser and Commercial Intelligencer (Alexandria, VA). April 26, 1803.
Republican Star or Eastern Shore General Advertiser (Easton, MD). April 26, 1803.
Leonard, Cynthia Miller, ed. The General Assembly of Virginia, July 30, 1619 - January 11, 1978: A Bicentennial Register of Members. Richmond: Virginia State Library, 1978.
